alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 7:21AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 830 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over southern Maui mainly between Ulupalakua and Kaupo. Rain was falling at rates up to 1.5 inches per hour. Meanwhile, heavy rain has diminished over West Maui and the Maui Central Valley. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kahului, Kihei, Lahaina, Maalaea, Puunene, Waikapu, Wailuku, Waiehu, Pukalani, Haliimaile, Paia, Wailea, Waihee, Keokea, Kula, Makawao, Olowalu, Pauwela, Ulupalakua and Haiku- Pauwela. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 830 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action.
